title: The Smell-Taste Connection
description: A fast breakdown of The Smell-Taste Connection for builders.

hook.text: Hold your nose and eat a jelly beanâ€”you can't tell the flavor. Smell is 80% of what we call taste.

buildup.text: Olfactory receptors detect thousands of molecules, sending signals faster than any other sense.

discovery.text: Bakeries and coffee shops vent aromas outside deliberately to trigger hunger in passersby.

twist.text: People who lose their sense of smell often lose weight because food becomes unappetizing and joyless.

punchline.text: Smell is the hidden architect of every meal you enjoy.
